title: Optimal Tariffs with Geopolitical Alignment
summary: Here is a new NBER working paper: As geopolitical tensions intensify, great powers often turn to trade policy to influence international alignment. We examine the optimal design of tariffs in a world where large countries care not only about economic welfare but also about the...
fullContent: Here is a new NBER working paper: As geopolitical tensions intensify, great powers often turn to trade policy to influence international alignment. We examine the optimal design of tariffs in a world where large countries care not only about economic welfare but also about the political allegiance of smaller states. title: Freedom from Volatility: Why patience could be investors greatest edge
summary: Market volatility can be unsettling, but patience is an investor’s greatest ally. By staying invested, embracing long-term horizons, diversifying, and reinvesting returns, investors can harness compounding, ride out downturns, and build wealth over time—proving that time in...
fullContent: Market volatility can be unsettling, but patience is an investor’s greatest ally. By staying invested, embracing long-term horizons, diversifying, and reinvesting returns, investors can harness compounding, ride out downturns, and build wealth over time—proving that time in the market beats timing it.

title: Western Australia Wheat Outlook Improves Dramatically After Rain
summary: Sweeping rain over the past month has put Western Australia on track for a near-record grain crop this season, according to an industry group, which raised its estimates for wheat production by more than 20%.
fullContent: Sweeping rain over the past month has put Western Australia on track for a near-record grain crop this season, according to an industry group, which raised its estimates for wheat production by more than 20%.

title: Tall ask for policymakers as growth risks persist despite positive rural signals: HSBC MF
summary: Despite RBI's confidence in maintaining a 6.5% GDP growth for FY26 and projecting 6.6% for Q1 FY27, HSBC Mutual Fund's Shriram Ramanathan expresses caution. He acknowledges tailwinds from rural consumption and resilient services but notes concerns about urban discretionary...
fullContent: Despite RBI's confidence in maintaining a 6.5% GDP growth for FY26 and projecting 6.6% for Q1 FY27, HSBC Mutual Fund's Shriram Ramanathan expresses caution. He acknowledges tailwinds from rural consumption and resilient services but notes concerns about urban discretionary spending and tepid private capex. Ramanathan emphasizes the need for policymakers to balance growth confidence with macro stability amid global uncertainties.

title: Tariffs on India over Russian oil prompted Moscow to seek talks with US: Trump
summary: "I think everything has an impact," and claimed that when he told India that "we're going to charge you, because you're dealing with Russia and oil purchases, it essentially took them out of buying oil from Russia"

title: Bisleri will always remain a privately-held firm, says VC Jayanti Chauhan
summary: Jayanti Chauhan, vice-chairperson of Bisleri International, affirms the company will remain private, dismissing any IPO or stake sale. Bisleri is set to ramp up investments in manufacturing, distribution, and product development, allocating ₹600 crore this year.
fullContent: Jayanti Chauhan, vice-chairperson of Bisleri International, affirms the company will remain private, dismissing any IPO or stake sale. Bisleri is set to ramp up investments in manufacturing, distribution, and product development, allocating ₹600 crore this year. Chauhan also urges government intervention to combat counterfeit bottled water, emphasizing the need for stronger laws to protect public health and the brand's integrity.

title: No pause on Russian oil imports, India continues imports based on economic rationale
summary: While discounts had previously reached as high as $40 per barrel, they have narrowed to just $ 1.5 late last month, resulting in reduced offtake. Discounts have since widened to about $2.70.
fullContent: While discounts had previously reached as high as $40 per barrel, they have narrowed to just $ 1.5 late last month, resulting in reduced offtake. Discounts have since widened to about $2.70.

title: RBI issues draft regulations on forex guarantees
summary: The Reserve Bank of India is framing rules for foreign exchange guarantees. These rules impact Indian citizens involved in such guarantees. Individuals need RBI's approval to act as surety. Reporting of guarantees and any changes is mandatory within seven days.
fullContent: The Reserve Bank of India is framing rules for foreign exchange guarantees. These rules impact Indian citizens involved in such guarantees. Individuals need RBI's approval to act as surety. Reporting of guarantees and any changes is mandatory within seven days. Late reporting attracts a fee. A three-year window is available for late fee payments.

title: RBI issues draft regulations on forex guarantees
summary: The Reserve Bank of India is framing rules for foreign exchange guarantees. These rules impact Indian citizens involved in such guarantees. Individuals need RBI's approval to act as surety. Reporting of guarantees and any changes is mandatory within seven days.

title: India to set data standards for developed nations to follow: CEA
summary: India is poised to establish global benchmarks in data quality, according to Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran. This ambition arises amidst concerns about data accuracy in developed nations.
fullContent: India is poised to establish global benchmarks in data quality, according to Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran. This ambition arises amidst concerns about data accuracy in developed nations. The Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI) aims to enhance data robustness by introducing a Service Production Index, mirroring the Index of Industrial Production.

title: Tata Sons AGM marks SP Group thaw, Noel Tata joins board
summary: At the Tata Sons AGM, the Shapoorji Pallonji Group approved all resolutions, signaling improved relations. Discussions are underway regarding SP Group's potential exit and monetization options, with Tata Sons exploring avenues.
fullContent: At the Tata Sons AGM, the Shapoorji Pallonji Group approved all resolutions, signaling improved relations. Discussions are underway regarding SP Group's potential exit and monetization options, with Tata Sons exploring avenues. Revenue has nearly doubled and net profit has more than tripled over the past five years, with the group adopting a 'fitness first, velocity next' mantra.
